CRD_Laezel.synopsis: The player approaches Lae'zel on their first night resting at camp. She's impatient and reminds the player that they need to find a creche and a cure for the parasite.

CRD_Narrator.synopsis: Narrator Fallback for Camp Night 1 CRDs
CRD_Narrator.how_to_trigger: Go to sleep on night 1 and don't bring companions

CRD_Astarion.synopsis: Astarion's trying to adjust to the novelty of being asleep during the night, instead of prowling the streets. The player doesn't know he's a vampire yet, and Astarion doesn't want them to find out. He tells them he has too much to think about to just fall asleep, so offers to take the first watch that night. Emotionally, he finds all of this novel and is curious about his new situation (moving around during the day, resting at night)

CRD_Karlach.synopsis: The player approaches Karlach on their first night at camp during the ceremorphosis.
CRD_Karlach.how_to_trigger: 1. Recruit Karlach as a companion.2. oe qnight NIGHT_Ceremorphosis1_98059567-b62a-4db8-9ce4-d39c792e02383. Speak with her.

CRD_Shadowheart.synopsis: The party has stopped to camp for the first time. The player can speak to Shadowheart as they rest. She restates the urgent need to find a healer who can help them with their tadpole problem. If the player elected to confide in other party members ahead of her she'll caution that they may not be trustworthy.

CRD_Laezel_6.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_6.text: A monster forms inside us, and you think to be idle?

CRD_Laezel_4.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_4.text: I did not expect you to prove quite so... fragile.

CRD_Laezel_18.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_18.text: Be quick about your rest. We must hurry towards the crèche.

CRD_Laezel_9.speaker: Player
CRD_Laezel_9.text: We need to pace ourselves. Don't you know an exhausted warrior is an ineffective one?

CRD_Laezel_8.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_8.text: A thickheaded notion in a complex circumstance.

CRD_Laezel_17.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_17.text: Do you suppose the parasites inside us dare to rest? That the ghaik do not still pursue us with each peal of the bell?

CRD_Laezel_2.speaker: Player
CRD_Laezel_2.text: We're hardly going to turn in our sleep... are we?

CRD_Laezel_10.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_10.text: The parasites inside us do not rest. Even as we speak, they defile our brains and warp our bones.
CRD_Laezel_10.context: NodeContext: Still cold, but with just a slight hint of background heat.

CRD_Laezel_13.speaker: Player
CRD_Laezel_13.text: This crèche notion of yours - are you sure it's our only option?

CRD_Laezel_3.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_3.text: I do not trust a common healer to extract a ghaik tadpole without killing its host. At a crèche, a ghustil may cleanse us - safely.

CRD_Laezel_5.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_5.text: Take your rest. I will stand watch.

CRD_Laezel_11.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_11.text: Should a single tentacle split your skull, I will not hesitate to end you.
CRD_Laezel_11.context: NodeContext: Not angry. Just ice to the bone.

CRD_Laezel_1.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_1.text: Be quick about your rest. We must locate a crèche.

CRD_Laezel_14.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_14.text: I knew your kind to be fragile. But I didn't foresee the severity.

CRD_Laezel_7.speaker: Lae'zel
CRD_Laezel_7.text: A monster forms inside us, yet you waste time with idle chatter.

CRD_Narrator_2.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Narrator_2.text: *The air is still. Your mind, however, is another matter.*

CRD_Narrator_0.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Narrator_0.text: *You're sure you can feel the parasite tickling your skull. How long before your limbs start to twist and knot? How long before tentacles erupt from your face?*

CRD_Narrator_1.speaker: Narrator
CRD_Narrator_1.text: *The questions fill your mind to bursting. Only time holds the answers. But in the here and now, that is no comfort at all.*

CRD_Astarion_7.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_7.text: Bit of a grim mood tonight. Sounds like the others don't relish the thought of sprouting tentacles.

CRD_Astarion_25.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_25.text: Understandable. Can't say I'm a fan either. It's just hard to join in when all of this feels so new.

CRD_Astarion_8.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_8.text: Your magician seems dour tonight. Must not relish the idea of sprouting tentacles.

CRD_Astarion_13.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_13.text: Your gith friend seems on edge. Mustn't relish the thought of sprouting tentacles.

CRD_Astarion_18.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_18.text: Shadowheart seems jumpy. Must not relish the thought of sprouting tentacles.

CRD_Astarion_20.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_20.text: So, we're resting here? Turning in for the night?

CRD_Astarion_5.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_5.text: It's no feather bed, but it'll do.

CRD_Astarion_21.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_21.text: I suppose. I'm not sure what I expected, really. This is all a little new.

CRD_Astarion_27.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_27.text: What? You've never slept in the woods before?

CRD_Astarion_29.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_29.text: It's all a little new to me, I admit.

CRD_Astarion_16.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_16.text: Keep walking if you want. I'm getting some rest.

CRD_Astarion_14.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_14.text: No, I'm more than happy to put my feet up. I'm just not used to this.
CRD_Astarion_14.context: NodeContext: 'this' is a little nebulous, he's referring to sleeping at night, camping, being out of the city - it's all new

CRD_Astarion_30.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_30.text: The night normally means bustling streets, bursting taverns.

CRD_Astarion_6.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_6.text: Curling up in the dirt and resting is... a little novel.

CRD_Astarion_22.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_22.text: Give it a try. We'll need to be fresh tomorrow.

CRD_Astarion_15.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_15.text: I'm in no place to rest yet. Today has been a lot.

CRD_Astarion_23.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_23.text: Rest or don't. It's up to you.

CRD_Astarion_1.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_1.text: I'll be awake awhile yet. Today has been a lot.

CRD_Astarion_3.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_3.text: I need some time to think things through. To process this.
CRD_Astarion_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Taps his temple at 'this'NodeContext: Taps his temple at 'this' - he's referring to the tadpole in his brain

CRD_Astarion_12.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_12.text: Thank you. I'll sleep better for that.

CRD_Astarion_0.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_0.text: The pleasure is all mine. Sweet dreams.

CRD_Astarion_2.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_2.text: I'm not tired yet. I'll sleep later.

CRD_Astarion_28.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_28.text: We'll both stay up. I'm not sleeping helpless in front of a stranger.

CRD_Astarion_26.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_26.text: You know, if you want to spend time with me you only have to say so.

CRD_Astarion_24.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_24.text: But suit yourself. I'm sure we'll drift off at some point.

CRD_Astarion_17.speaker: Player
CRD_Astarion_17.text: The right herbs can make a soothing tea, if you can't settle in.

CRD_Astarion_4.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_4.text: Ah, no - tea isn't really my drink.
CRD_Astarion_4.context: NodeContext: Players don't know he's a vampire

CRD_Astarion_11.speaker: Astarion
CRD_Astarion_11.text: I'll be awake awhile anyway. I need some time to think things through. To process this.
CRD_Astarion_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Taps his temple at 'this'NodeContext: Taps his temple at 'this' - he's referring to the tadpole in his brain

CRD_Gale_23.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_23.context: NodeContext: Gale is standing by the fire, contemplating the flames.

CRD_Gale_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale is standing by the fire, contemplating the flames.

CRD_Gale_14.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_14.text: And good evening to you too.

CRD_Gale_7.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_7.text: Was there anything in particular I did to deserve such a greeting?

CRD_Gale_1.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_1.text: Oh. Nothing, nothing. I'm just poorly making a point.

CRD_Gale_4.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_4.text: 'Go to Hell.' An everyday expression. So trivial it's almost meaningless.

CRD_Gale_17.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_17.text: But we've seen Hell. It's real. And it isn't trivial.

CRD_Gale_10.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_10.text: Devils, dragons, mind flayers - they used to be abstracts. Pictures on a piece of paper.

CRD_Gale_2.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_2.text: What a difference a day makes.

CRD_Gale_29.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_29.text: Now we have tadpoles slithering through our heads like carnivorous foeti.

CRD_Gale_30.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_30.text: I'm not too worried. We'll find someone who can help us.

CRD_Gale_16.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_16.text: That's the spirit. Let's be up with the lark - find a healer before the wee one gets hungry.

CRD_Gale_6.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_6.text: Perhaps you should get some rest.

CRD_Gale_8.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_8.text: This ballet of flames invites reflection. But you're right.

CRD_Gale_20.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_20.text: Let's be up with the lark - find a healer before the wee one gets hungry.

CRD_Gale_27.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_27.text: Brooding will get us nowhere. Action will.

CRD_Gale_12.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_12.text: What can I say but that you're right? We're in deep you-know-what.

CRD_Gale_13.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_13.text: I'll wake you bright and early. We'll need to find a healer before the wee one gets hungry.

CRD_Gale_5.speaker: Player
CRD_Gale_5.text: You sound a tad more dejected than when we first met.

CRD_Gale_22.speaker: Gale
CRD_Gale_22.text: Hold your horses! I'm just poorly making a point.

CRD_Karlach_3.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_3.text: Haven't gone camping since I was a little girl. Very exciting.

CRD_Karlach_15.speaker: Player
CRD_Karlach_15.text: Where'd you sleep in the Hells?

CRD_Karlach_13.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_13.text: Rough. You've seen Avernus - nothing but rocks and evil pricks as far as the eye can see.

CRD_Karlach_28.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_28.text: But this - a fire, a bit of nature, and a spot to call my own - this is nice.

CRD_Karlach_19.speaker: Player
CRD_Karlach_19.text: It's been a while for me, too. This is all so unusual.

CRD_Karlach_34.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_34.text: You can say that again. Weird turn after weird turn, with the occasional twist of luck on top. Someone out there's either looking out for us, or fucking with us.

CRD_Karlach_1.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_1.text: Either way, it's pretty interesting. If I turn into a mind flayer tomorrow, I can't say it wasn't an exciting ride.

CRD_Karlach_23.speaker: Player
CRD_Karlach_23.text: This isn't camping - it's making camp.

CRD_Karlach_16.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_16.text: So no campfire songs and ghost stories for ol' Karlach. Damn, I thought I was out of the Hells.

CRD_Karlach_9.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_9.text: Guess you can't have it all. To be honest, a fire, a bit of nature, and a bedroll of my own is more than enough - more than I thought I'd ever have.

CRD_Karlach_21.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_21.text: If I turn into a mind flayer tomorrow, I'll at least have gone out on a high note.

CRD_Karlach_35.speaker: Player
CRD_Karlach_35.text: That won't happen - we're going to find a cure.

CRD_Karlach_29.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_29.text: Damn straight we are. I've got a lot of living to do, and I'm going to need my horn for most of it.

CRD_Karlach_4.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_4.text: Guess we ought to rest up, eh soldier? If today's been any indication, tomorrow's going to keep us on our toes.

CRD_Karlach_0.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_0.text: Gods, my bed looks so good I could cry. Goodnight, sleep tight, don't let the lemures bite.

CRD_Karlach_36.speaker: Player
CRD_Karlach_36.text: If you turn into a mind flayer tomorrow, I will take your head.

CRD_Karlach_12.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_12.text: Ah-ah. If I'm a mind flayer, you are too. Checkmate, spots.

CRD_Karlach_38.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_38.text: Almost went to chat up the githyanki myself, but then I thought - you know what, Karlach? You don't need to lose a finger tonight. You just got home.

CRD_Karlach_27.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_27.text: I considered going to make nice with Wyll, but I thought he might want a little space from little old me.

CRD_Karlach_17.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_17.text: Astarion's a riot, isn't he? Reminds me of a noble I knew back in the Gate. Wit like a dagger, hair like my granny.
CRD_Karlach_17.context: NodeContext: 'A riot' is a weird way to describe Astarion, so Karlach might be being a little sarcastic here, but she does like Astarion. Taking the piss a bit.

CRD_Karlach_33.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_33.text: You're doing a good job keeping this merry band of freaks together. Good leaders are hard to come by, you know.

CRD_Karlach_14.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_14.text: Never thought I'd be so keen to take orders from a future mind flayer. But that's tomorrow's problem, isn't it? Right now I'm not worried about anything but where these pyjamas came from.
CRD_Karlach_14.context: NodeContext: Joking around. She's also a future mind flayer

CRD_Karlach_18.speaker: Player
CRD_Karlach_18.text: No one's turning into a mind flayer - least of all me.

CRD_Karlach_6.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_6.text: Me either. I've got a lot of living to do, and I'm going to need my horn for most of it.

CRD_Karlach_10.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_10.text: Good night, sleep tight, don't let the lemures bite.

CRD_Karlach_30.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_30.text: Gale's pretty lost in his thoughts, isn't he. Poor guy. Roughing it like this can't be his style.

CRD_Karlach_24.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_24.text: Couldn't help but overhear you and Shadowheart earlier. She's a little prickly, but I like her.

CRD_Karlach_25.speaker: Karlach
CRD_Karlach_25.text: Hey, soldier. Doing the rounds before bed, ey?

CRD_Shadowheart_40.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_40.text: I'm not sure this is a good idea.

CRD_Shadowheart_43.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_43.text: Sure what is a good idea?

CRD_Shadowheart_39.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_39.text: There are lit fuses in our heads. Sooner or later, they're going to blow.

CRD_Shadowheart_15.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_15.text: Each hour that passes, the thing inside us grows. We need to find a healer. Let's wake up at first light.

CRD_Shadowheart_20.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_20.text: Agreed. Our top priority, as far as I'm concerned.

CRD_Shadowheart_58.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_58.text: Maybe we will get lucky. We're overdue some good fortune.

CRD_Shadowheart_77.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_77.text: Fine. But it won't be easy, searching this wilderness.

CRD_Shadowheart_3.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_3.text: Maybe. But we might get lucky. We're overdue some good fortune.

CRD_Shadowheart_59.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_59.text: This is unfamiliar territory. Rushing will only land us in more trouble than we can handle.

CRD_Shadowheart_48.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_48.text: That sort of danger - I'm fine with. I can fight it.

CRD_Shadowheart_65.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_65.text: Relax. This camp seems safe from threats.

CRD_Shadowheart_29.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_29.text: Don't fret. We need some rest.

CRD_Shadowheart_23.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_23.text: Fine. But not for too long.

CRD_Shadowheart_87.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_87.text: Spare me the petty tyrant routine - you're better than that.
CRD_Shadowheart_87.context: InternalNodeContext: If SH's approval of  the player is greater than 0NodeContext: Slightly miffed. Thinks the player's dismissive response is beneath them

CRD_Shadowheart_63.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_63.text: You should get some rest. We've got hard times ahead.

CRD_Shadowheart_84.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_84.text: Oh, it's going to be like that? I love strong ones.

CRD_Shadowheart_60.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_60.text: Get some rest. We move at dawn.

CRD_Shadowheart_64.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_64.text: Doing the rounds, are you? You'd better get some rest.

CRD_Shadowheart_49.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_49.text: What were you two talking about?

CRD_Shadowheart_73.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_73.text: You strike me as the reliable sort, but are you sure this is a good idea?
CRD_Shadowheart_73.context: InternalNodeContext: This node if SH approves of the player for 0 or moreNodeContext: Questioning, but in a respectful way.

CRD_Shadowheart_80.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_80.text: What were you two talking about?

CRD_Shadowheart_19.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_19.text: No, you've lost me. No idea what you're talking about.

CRD_Shadowheart_61.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_61.text: Fine. Just don't expect my confidence if I don't have yours.

CRD_Shadowheart_79.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_79.text: If that was any of your business, we'd have called you over.

CRD_Shadowheart_42.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_42.text: Wrong. Your business is mine. We're entwined, thanks to this.
CRD_Shadowheart_42.context: NodeContext: Shadowheart taps a finger against/gestures to her temple (whichever can be accomplished)

CRD_Shadowheart_7.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_7.text: If we're to survive, we need to trust each other.

CRD_Shadowheart_86.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_86.text: You seem reliable. I think you know how important it is that we find someone who can cure us. Best if we focus on that.
CRD_Shadowheart_86.context: InternalNodeContext: If SH's approval of  the player is greater than 0

CRD_Shadowheart_78.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_78.text: And just to be clear, come daybreak, finding a healer is our first priority.

CRD_Shadowheart_38.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_38.text: Agreed. The sooner we find someone to help us, the better.

CRD_Shadowheart_35.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_35.text: Good. We might even get lucky and find one right away. As I see it, we're overdue some good fortune. Rest well.

CRD_Shadowheart_5.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_5.text: It's late. We can talk about this in the morning.

CRD_Shadowheart_11.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_11.text: We did just talk about it. Let's rest.

CRD_Shadowheart_71.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_71.text: Let's not abandon all caution. This is unfamiliar territory.

CRD_Shadowheart_74.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_74.text: Caution is a luxury we don't have. Let's rest and wake up at first light.

CRD_Shadowheart_2.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_2.text: This isn't all bad. The tadpoles seem to have given us powers.

CRD_Shadowheart_34.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_34.text: These powers must have a price. They come from invasive parasites that will turn us into mind flayers.

CRD_Shadowheart_53.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_53.text: We need to get rid of them.

CRD_Shadowheart_1.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_1.text: Rest well. We'll need our strength.

CRD_Shadowheart_13.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_13.text: We were just discussing the next steps.

CRD_Shadowheart_12.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_12.text: She's not of this world. I'd be surprised if our interests remained aligned.

CRD_Shadowheart_76.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_76.text: Let's hope we rapidly find a healer.

CRD_Shadowheart_70.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_70.text: Heroic types can be brittle, I find. Better to trust someone with greater flexibility.

CRD_Shadowheart_24.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_24.text: You like to stir things up, don't you? Stop looking for trouble and stay focused.

CRD_Shadowheart_72.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_72.text: I was merely making an observation.

CRD_Shadowheart_21.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_21.text: ...But speaking of focus, let's be clear: come daybreak, finding a healer is our first priority, yes?

CRD_Shadowheart_31.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_31.text: I wasn't confiding in anyone. I was just talking.

CRD_Shadowheart_27.speaker: Player
CRD_Shadowheart_27.text: If anyone has me concerned, it's you. You haven't exactly been open about yourself.

CRD_Shadowheart_36.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_36.text: I think I've been more than candid - you know about my faith, for one thing.
CRD_Shadowheart_36.context: NodeContext: Referring to her Shar worship, which  the player is aware of here.

CRD_Shadowheart_18.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_18.text: I have my reasons - they're nothing for you to be concerned about.

CRD_Shadowheart_45.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_45.text: Either way, be careful. You never know what lengths someone might take to solve this little problem of ours.
CRD_Shadowheart_45.context: NodeContext: Litttle problem being the tadpoles.

CRD_Shadowheart_83.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_83.text: Trust is a rare currency. Not sure I'd spend it on someone who drew a knife on me moments after I met them.

CRD_Shadowheart_67.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_67.context: NodeContext: Gale pronounced same as the wind

CRD_Shadowheart_30.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_30.text: He's a wizard. All they care about is power.

CRD_Shadowheart_85.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_85.text: I'd be careful with who you confide in.

CRD_Shadowheart_57.speaker: Shadowheart
CRD_Shadowheart_57.text: Well, what do we really know about them...?
